Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as everyone says”
Reviews.Author: Bryon M
Reviews.Content: Not sure if there was a miraculous turn around after other people wrote really negative reviews but there was really nothing wrong with this hotel. You should know there are no frills about a Super 8. The area the hotel in was not as bad as people say. When I arrived the whole area seemed fairly clean and decent. I didnt see any homeless or possible criminals either. My room was spacious and very clean. Was a non-smoking room and it seems they kept it that way. Staff was very pleasant when I checked in and checked out. My only mistake was using a "bidding website". I would have gotten a better rate booking straight from the Wyndham website.

Reviews.Title: “Scary place!”
Reviews.Author: Chizzi
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here because it's close to my in-laws, but I was really concerned about my safety at night! Went over to the K-Mart next door to get a steering wheel lock. Breakfast was cold cereal and danishes. Pool was okay for the kids. There's other places at about the same price that would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Better to sleep in your car or under a bridge”
Reviews.Author: Dwayne N
Reviews.Content: I tend to be a relaxed traveler on a low budget so I dont expect anything fancy...but this dump was the pits, probably the worst hotel I've stayed in for over 30 years.The room itself was filthy,there where toe nail clippings on the floor and the furinture looked like it was dragged from the city dump.I think some bad event occured in the room since the door seemed to have been beaten on by a hammer or club and a quick,poorly done and cheap repair had been done to a hole punched in the bathroom door.The free wifi should have been free since it did not work, so I can't comment on the hi speed aspect.Sharing a parking lot with a open all night K-mart means a lot of noise,traffic and people just sort of hanging out.The staff seemed bored to death and the free all star breakfast was not available.I filled out a how was your experience e-mail from super (aint) with all this info and got a sweet gee sorry our hotel sucks and does not provide promised services but we hope you will choose us again.Avoid this hole at all costs and I would also avoid super (aint) in general.

Reviews.Title: “lower than one star”
Reviews.Author: coachbob
Reviews.Content: do not, do not stay here! surly staff, frequent police visits, dirty rooms. do not honor reservation requests. if there isa rating lower than one star, this place gets it.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on North Black Canyon”
Reviews.Author: catinlove87
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I am a very laid back person. I have traveled a lot and have stayed in Super 8's, Motel 6's and other hole in the wall motels. I was on vacation with a friend and took the airport shuttle to Super 8 (fyi, the shuttle is GREAT). I had paid and reserved the room online, so I ran to the front desk, checked in and got my key(s). Our room was on the 2nd floor, basically in the middle. Upon arrival to the room, I placed my bag down and unpacked my things into the drawers and hung up pants, etc. I then ran to the bathroom. The tub was filthy with hair and soap scum, and the toilet had not been cleaned. There was used and nasty toilet paper stuck in the seat. I then left the bathroom and looked at my sheets which were stained with blood or something. I called the front desk and asked if they could have someone come up and clean the room. They said they would, and offered a different room. I declined because I had already unpacked and told them I'd rather just have the room cleaned and be confident that it had been done. I waited over 45 min for someone. I called the front desk again and asked if I could just clean my own room and use their supplies. The woman told me that they couldn't let me do that and that someone would be up shortly. 25 minutes later a woman did show up and asked me what the problem was. I walked her through the room and showed her the filth all over the place. I asked for new sheets. She then handed me the cleaning products. I told her that the woman downstairs told me I could not use them. She said it was fine, so I set forth cleaning the entire room and changing my sheets. From then on, the staff treated my friend and I poorly and when I attempted to speak to the manager about all of this, he shrugged it off like it was nothing. I gave him a speech on customer service and that if someone is paying for certain services, they should be done. And that it was pathetic that I ended up having to clean my own room because of the lack of customer service there was. We stayed for seven days. Our third night in, the guests in the room next to ours were making all kinds of noise ALL NIGHT. I called front desk and told them. Nothing happened. The next night the same guests ended up having the police come to their room and two people got arrested. The remainder of the nights, we had many guests go through that room next to ours, all of them loud and obnoxious. Not surprising as this hotel is in the GHETTO. The K-Mart in the adjoining parking lot had a shooting two nights before we arrived in AZ which I had seen on the news while there. The staff was not even knowledgeable about things to do in the area. I have been to Phoenix many times and was looking to try something new. They just pointed me to the brochure stand. My car rental woman was more helpful than the hotel staff, and she didn't even live in the area! Their claim to have great WIFI was a scam. My friend who was with me is a computer tech nerd and experienced issues on a regular basis even finding a connection. One good thing was the pool. It was kept clean and everything. The chairs were broken and old, but other than that, there was a clean pool and hot tub. Overall, while it was a place to sleep, there are much better options than putting yourself in this type of situation. I usually just keep my mouth shut and go with the flow, as I understand all of us have our bad days and sometimes things just aren't the way we'd like them, but the staff, service, and services at this motel were atrocious.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Super-8!”
Reviews.Author: sapphire_tyger
Reviews.Content: I would like to preface this by saying, whenever I travel, if there is a Super-8 conveniently located, I stay there. I so far have not had a bad Super-8 experience. This one is no exception. Located right off I-17, easy to find and get to. The front desk staff was friendly, helpful, and very cool. Even when I inadvertently ended up thinking the Motel 6 next door was also their building and went to the wrong room, they laughed it off and were very nice about it when I came back and complained, and they had to explain my mistake. The room smelled wonderful and was spotless! A huge plus with me! Plenty of clean towels, soap, shampoo, coffee for the coffeemaker supplied. Easy access to the WiFi connection. When I returned to my room the following day, the room had been cleaned but none of my things were out of order. The Kmart within walking distance is a bonus, for those "oops" things that travelers tend to forget, as well. My only complaint would be the continental breakfast - some coffee, a pitcher of apple juice, a toaster and loaf of bread, two kinds of cereal and a jug of milk. Lucky for me I was not counting on the breakfast, as the conference I was attending down the street had a wonderful spread. Check-out was a breeze and again, the front desk staff was very friendly. Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Don't get stuck on the first floor”
Reviews.Author: StapletonCO
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here during our winter roadtrip across the southwest and the main thing which stuck out in my mind was the creaking ceiling above us being caused by a couple and their kid in the room above us. They weren't running around and dancing, simply walking around the room like normal and we would hear every single step and creakiness. It was loud enough to disturb us whilst watching tv and easily woke us up in the middle of the night due to someone up there walking late night to the bathroom. The room itself was basically your average Super8 except the bathroom and sink had very nasty mold build-up in the corners. The hot tub and pool were awesome and heated I believe. The downside though is that the continental breakfast is cramped into the corner of the lobby and the 2 tables they had pretty much added to the crampedness so we had to wait in line for about 5 minutes while all of 3 people in front of us got food. When we got to the food (at 8:15 am, their breakfast bar ended at 9 am) they were out of juice and bread and at one point milk (but luckily they brought out a new one eventually) and the high-point was the individual packages of 'HoneyBuns' they had (instead of muffins). All I have to say is it really looks bad when you advertise a breakfast and then run out of food/juice. I mean seriously, us 'Super8er's' mostly go to Super8's because they're low-cost and promise breakfasts and if you can't provide a decent breakfast then I have to go to the next alternative (ie fast food) which will 'eat up' any cost savings I get from staying at Super8 and so if you force me to spend on breakfast I might as well have stayed at the next rung up of hotels which offers a free breakfast. I might stay here again however there's no way I'd stay on the first floor again (because I like sleep) and I would probably have to get up much earlier than normal (at like 6 am) just so I could actually have juice and more of a breakfast because some manager doesn't know how to forecast how much juice/bread/milk to buy. Overall though, the hotel supply in Phoenix is so elastic and the prices so similar that I will probably try out a Super8 competitor with the same offering and same price just so I don't have to take a chance with this Super8.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but DON'T reserve online”
Reviews.Author: deelightfull
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this room using reward points, so it was free to me. But I was considering booking online. The best price online was $45, when we pulled up I could see that the sign had a price of $32 listed. I even called ahead of time and asked about their best rate and got a rate of $60. Unless you know everything will be booked, I would wait till getting there. The room was fine, no bad odors. As a matter of fact, there was the faint smell of laundry softener as we walked in. Beds were VERY firm, which is standard for a Super 8. We didn't have any issues with sound leaking in from other rooms or the highway. Breakfast was not the best Super 8 breakfast I've ever had, but acceptable. Two kinds of cold cereal, milk, two juices, individually packaged pastries, a loaf of white bread and butter and jam, as well as a toaster oven. no bagels or cream cheese. Staff was very nice, especially considering we were there on Christmas Eve and Christmas morning. Oh, and there was a computer (a mac) Up in the lobby available for a quick email check or boarding pass print or what ever. A perfectly fine Super 8 experience, especially considering I didn't pay anything out of pocket!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience. Very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Pozzart
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this place. I had a pleasant stay with no problems. The rooms were clean and there was Wi-Fi so I was able to use my laptop to connect to the internet. I liked the continental breakfast nothing special but what can you expect for the low price of the room. I will return to this Super 8 when ever I am on the area for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!! Great staff and the rooms were perfect.”
Reviews.Author: clubsandsand
Reviews.Content: I come to Phoneix on business 5 times a year from L.A and every time i come here i am gretted by front desk with a smile,this attitude makes my visit to Phoenix a pleasure.The rooms are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: angustheunruled
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right off freeway but far enough back that you can't hear noise. Got a good rate and desk clerks were very helpful with directions and area information. Rooms were clean and comfortable, swimming pool was clean. Breakfast was well-stocked, but lobby was a little crowded so I went back to my room to eat, which was fine. Will definitely stay here again next time I'm in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “A great place and value all in one!!”
Reviews.Author: jgalde
Reviews.Content: This place offered the best experience ever, since I was looking for directions for a weeding and was not looking for a room I decided to stop here and ask for help. The man at the desk smiled upon my arrival and greeted me very politely, I explained to him that I was not looking for accommodations, but that I needed help with some directions. He printed step-by-step directions for me, and refuse to charge me for it, and I was more than willing to pay for his trouble. I had never experienced this level of customer service and this convinced me to stay here even tough I already had accommodations at a relatives house. I definitely recommend this place. Great value and people!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: AdviceonHotels
Reviews.Content: We checked in and had to check out within 10 minutes of check-in. The place was musty and dirty and my sister with asthma could not stay there. We asked for a credit, but instead were billed for both nights, and had to take up credits with our credit card company. In the end, we had to pay for the 1st night because of the hotel policy. Hotels.com didn't help either. DID'NT RECEIVE A SERVICE AND STILL HAD TO PAY...You don't want to stay here! We have asked Hotels.com to take this property off their list.

Reviews.Title: “great bargain”
Reviews.Author: whomever
Reviews.Content: the rate was great- $33 a night with the aarp discount, cheaper than the motel 6 next door. the room was comparable to a motel 6 room but it had a better tub/shower. there was in-room coffee and 60 channels of cable tv. the breakfast was ok- cereal, toast, juices, rolls, coffee. it was quiet but you can hear some of the nearby interstate traffic- i used the fan to drown out the noise. the only negative was a filthy carpet- it needed to be shampooed.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Dadecat
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right off Interstate 17, so easy access. Instructions say immediate right off exit and they mean that! Close to gas stations and shopping center. Check in was easy and smooth. Checked in before the stated time and no problem. Room was clean and clean smelling; your typical basic Super 8. Yes, you are close to the interstate noise, but the fan from the A/C covered that noise. Breakfast was very spartin; they must have gotten a deal at Costco on donoughts and bagles! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: caspyboy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our room on the hotel's website and found check-in to be easy and fast. We were given a room on the ground floor near the lobby, which concerned us at first because we were afraid there would be noise. There wasn't. We stayed for two nights and found that considering the location, it was quiet and non-eventful. The room was very clean and exceeded our expectations. The room had a coffee maker, which we used upon arrival, however free coffee is available in the lobby 24 hours. This hotel also includes free breakfast, which was very basic, but considering the price we weren't complaining. It consisted of coffee, juice, two kinds of cereal, bagels w/cream cheese and a few cakes. There are only two tables for eating breakfast, so on the second morning we took our food back to our room to eat - again, we weren't bothered by this. Other features: Free wi-fi, which was nice, although the connection was pretty slow. Full cable tv, including HBO. Overall, this hotel was a pleasant surprise for us. The most important part being that the rooms were very clean. It's a simple, great value motel and we'd returm if we ever visit Phoenix again.

Reviews.Title: “the place after a long airflight”
Reviews.Author: brunoffrance
Reviews.Content: Paid $80 for a night... TOO much for a motel of this category. But it is the best place to sleep when you arrive from the intl airport after too much hours in an international airflight. No better price in this area . Continental breakfast and wifi. Greta courtesey from the manager.

Reviews.Title: “slightly above average”
Reviews.Author: Grec
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at the hotel and found what I had expected: a clean room, a comfy bed, a TV, wireless internet access, a coffee in the morning, and a hot shower. Nothing more but nothing less and the rate was okay. The neighbourhood looks a bit dodgy but I didn't have any problems. The only thing that annoyed me were the two trucks starting their engines at 4am on the premises next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special at all”
Reviews.Author: ScottBanks
Reviews.Content: This motel is just okay. Nothing special. About the typical Super 8 motel. Area around hotel is dirty. When checking in, I was informed that a nonsmoking room was not available (even though I reserved one). The guy at the front desk said "you gotta take the smoking room. Take it or leave it". Not much customer service skills, I tell you! I took the smoking room. It reaked of cig smoke. I walked over to the KMart next door and bought air freshners. That helped a bit. Outdoor pool was small and dirty and looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a while. Since all the other nicer hotels/motels were booked, I had to stay at the Super 8 and make the best of it. Would NOT stay at his motel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this place.”
Reviews.Author: joanlucky
Reviews.Content: Website says airport transportation. When you call for transportation, you are told they only provide it between 9 and 5. They don't mention this when you make a reservation, either. So you get stuck with a $24 cab ride. Not your typical Super 8. Building was very old and needed updating. Door had a lock, a deadbolt, and a chain. After arriving after dark, you got the feeling you needed all three. Adjoining property's fence was topped with razor wire. Houses in the neighborhood had iron bars over the doors and windows. Pool looked great but wasn't heated so it was too cold to use in the end of March. To be truthful, even though it was old and worn, it was clean. The bathroom was so tiny it was difficult to use. It would have been better to spend the extra money on a better place that had 24 hour airport transportation than waste it on cab fare and stay here. There are better choices. It you are looking for budget motels and the area doesn't bother you, there is a huge Motel 6 across the street that seemed to be in better shape.

HotelInfo.Name: Phoenix Metro North Super 8 Motel
